channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report E-2023110011
item.description:
Report E-2023110011

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: W SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 19, 2023, one (1) one-gallon pail of UN2922 was crushed during transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. AS personnel removed all pallets from the freight and began collecting the damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew deployed absorbents and worked them in using hand tools. AS placed the absorbents in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023100925
item.description:
Report E-2023100925

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-05
  • City: PACOIMA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill of 2 metal canisters, each containing 1 gallon of Motor City Clearcoat (2.1 VOC), totaling 2 gallons at UFV. The damage was caused by improper loading at the ULA terminal causing these 2 canisters to be crushed. Terminal personnel were able to clean up the area with proper PPE and generated (1) 5 gal df of waste which was staged onsite and left for onsite terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100923

  • City: BLYTHE

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the off-loading process, a 4' X 10' area inside the trailer was impacted by 2.5 gallons of Gunsmoke Water Conditioner (due to fork blade puncture) from (1) 2.5 gallon container. The Contractor advised the impacted area was dry, so it was neutralized with Spillfyter Acid Neutralizer. No storm drains, soil, or waterways were impacted.

item.title: Report E-2023100911
item.description:
Report E-2023100911

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-06T09:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 18, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink was punctured while in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental (GE) to remediate the impacted site. GE personnel deployed granular absorbent to the trailer floor and worked them in with hand tools, utilizing a degreasing agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. The crew collected and containerized the damaged 55-gallon drum in one (1) 65-gallon overpack drum. All printing ink impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and RLC personnel took possession of the waste.

item.title: Report E-2023100900
item.description:
Report E-2023100900

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-06T09:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: BAKERSFIELD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a pallet of 8 metal drums arrived at the facility containing Hazardous Phenol Solution, UN2821, of which 2 of the drums were visibly damaged. The drums were corroded, with the paint being clearly corroded and reaching into the layer of metal. The corrosion has caused the caps to unseal from the container and an odor, although not strong, was emanating from the damaged drums. It was confirmed 10oz spilled onto the tops of 2 of the drums. Two DM of waste were created, 2-85 gal overpack containing an impacted drum, both were left staged onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100850
item.description:
Report E-2023100850

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal USA experienced a UN1197 Carmel FMF Liquid Concentrate Flavor release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a crack at the top corner of the tote. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all spent absorbents into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023091030
item.description:
Report X-2023091030

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM QA STATION IN POOR SHAPE. DISCOVERED AEROSOL CANS IN THE MIDDLE OF REPACK. NO MARKINGS ON OUTER CARTON NOR ORIENTATION ARROWS USED. TOO MUCH RECIRCULATION THROUGH THE OVERHEAD SORTER. BOX HAPHAZARDLY PACKED. DescribePack: THREE AEROSOL CANS WITH CAPS OFF AND SOME LEAKAGE. SPILL ISOLATED TO PACKAGING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED TOTE.

  • Description: BROWN BOX FOUND LEAKING ON BELT AFTER BEING UNLOADED FROM GROUND FEEDER TRAILER. PULLED FROM BELT AND PLACED INTO DMP. NO LABELS OTHER THAN SHIPPING LABEL ON OUTSIDE OF BROWN BOX. WHEN OPENED, RESPONDER FOUND 1-GALLON CONTAINER OF STAR SAN ACID CONCENTRATE CLEANER WITH LID TAPED ON. RESPONDER NOTICED LEAK COMING FROM SIDE BOTTOM OF CONTAINER. NO PACKING MATERIAL PROTECTING CONTAINER FOUND IN BOX. RESPONDER CONTACTED HELP DESK.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought back to the station by driver. Found by VSA desk with box in wet and torn condition. DescribePack: Inspection of contents resulted in cap being loose/failed. No holes, puncture marks or cracks visible on the damaged container. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Better handling of the package from the handlers to the driver. If the package was kept upright like it is supposed to, then this spill would have never happened.

item.title: Report X-2023081733
item.description:
Report X-2023081733

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-03T00:35:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-06
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 8/6/2023 at approximately 0020, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 916791 at the hub facility in Oakland, reporting an undeclared paint spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box containing one 2-liter metal can of paint. The shipment was disovered leaking during sort. It appears the closure failed on the inner container, resulting in spillage. Further investigation revealing that rthe contents that spilled appears to be paint, as the inner container is marked as "Coffee Bean Stain". The package is not marked, labeled, or prepared as dangerous goods shipment. The shipment has been placed in a salvage drum and being held, pending an investigation by the FAA.
